description: Creates a channel to which you can add users and send messages. Restriction: You can't change a channel's privacy.

parameters.name: AppInstanceArn
parameters.description: The ARN of the channel request.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: The client token for the request. An Idempotency token. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags for the creation request. (dict) --- A tag object containing a key-value pair. The key in a tag. The value in a tag.

parameters.name: ChimeBearer
parameters.description: The ARN of the AppInstanceUser or AppInstanceBot that makes the API call.

parameters.name: MemberArns
parameters.description: The ARNs of the channel members in the request. (string) ---

parameters.name: ModeratorArns
parameters.description: The ARNs of the channel moderators in the request. (string) ---

parameters.name: ElasticChannelConfiguration
parameters.description: The attributes required to configure and create an elastic channel. An elastic channel can support a maximum of 1-million users, excluding moderators. The maximum number of SubChannels that you want to allow in the elastic channel. The maximum number of members allowed in a SubChannel. The minimum allowed percentage of TargetMembershipsPerSubChannel users. Ceil of the calculated value is used in balancing members among SubChannels of the elastic channel.

nested_params.name: MaximumSubChannels
nested_params.description: The maximum number of SubChannels that you want to allow in the elastic channel.

nested_params.name: TargetMembershipsPerSubChannel
nested_params.description: The maximum number of members allowed in a SubChannel.

nested_params.name: MinimumMembershipPercentage
nested_params.description: The minimum allowed percentage of TargetMembershipsPerSubChannel users. Ceil of the calculated value is used in balancing members among SubChannels of the elastic channel.

parameters.name: ExpirationSettings
parameters.description: Settings that control the interval after which the channel is automatically deleted. The period in days after which the system automatically deletes a channel. The conditions that must be met for a channel to expire.

nested_params.name: ExpirationDays
nested_params.description: The period in days after which the system automatically deletes a channel.

nested_params.name: ExpirationCriterion
nested_params.description: The conditions that must be met for a channel to expire.
